me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.items

Class BaseSTBBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.items.BaseSTBItem
      • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.items.BaseSTBBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<BaseSTBItem>, InventoryGUIListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AngelicBlock, BaseSTBMachine, BlockUpdateDetector, Elevator, EnderBox, Floodlight, ItemRouter, PaintCan, RedstoneClock, SoundMuffler, TrashCan

    public abstract class BaseSTBBlock
extends BaseSTBItem
    Represents an STB block; an STB item which can be placed as a block in the world.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BaseSTBBlock.RelativePosition
      Represents the relative position of an auxiliary block from a multi-block structure.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.items.BaseSTBItem

        BaseSTBItem.ItemAction

    • Method Detail

      • freeze

        public YamlConfiguration freeze()
        Description copied from class: BaseSTBItem
        Freeze this object's state into a YamlConfiguration object. If you override this method to freeze additional object fields, your overridden method must call super.freeze() to get the frozen base object state and augment & return that.
        Overrides:
        freeze in class BaseSTBItem
        Returns:
        a YamlConfiguration representing this object's state

      • getRedstoneBehaviour

        public final RedstoneBehaviour getRedstoneBehaviour()
        Get this block's current redstone behaviour; whether it ignores the presence of a redstone signal, or requires the signal to be low or high to operate.
        Returns:
        the redstone behaviour

      • setRedstoneBehaviour

        public final void setRedstoneBehaviour(RedstoneBehaviour redstoneBehaviour)
        Set this block's redstone behaviour; whether it ignores the presence of a redstone signal, or requires the signal to be low or high to operate.
        Parameters:
        redstoneBehaviour - the new desired redstone behaviour

      • getAccessControl

        public final AccessControl getAccessControl()
        Get this block's current access control; whether players other than the owner may access the block's GUI or insert/extract items from it.
        Returns:
        the access control setting

      • setAccessControl

        public final void setAccessControl(AccessControl accessControl)
        Set this block's access control; whether players other than the owner may access the block's GUI or insert/extract items from it.
        Parameters:
        accessControl - the new desired access control

      • getGuiHolder

        public final STBGUIHolder getGuiHolder()

      • getGUI

        public final InventoryGUI getGUI()
        Get the GUI object for this block, if any has been created.
        Returns:
        the block's GUI (may be null)

      • getFacing

        public final BlockFace getFacing()
        Get the direction that this block faces. Note that the block may not necessarily have any visual representation of a facing direction.

        An STB block's initial facing direction is determined by the direction that the player who placed it was facing at the time.

        Returns:
        the facing direction of the block

      • setFacing

        public final void setFacing(BlockFace facing)
        Set the direction that this block faces. Note that the block may not necessarily have any visual representation of a facing direction, but label signs can be useful indicator.
        Parameters:
        facing - the desired new facing direction

      • getOwner

        public final UUID getOwner()
        Get the UUID of the player who owns this block. The initial owner of an STB block is the player who placed it.
        Returns:
        the owning player's UUID

      • setOwner

        public final void setOwner(UUID owner)
        Set the UUID of the owning player
        Parameters:
        owner - the new owning player's UUID

      • getTicksLived

        public final long getTicksLived()
        Get the number of ticks since this block was placed in the world. This will return 0 if called on a block which has not yet been placed, or on a block whose getTickRate() method returns 0.
        Returns:
        the number of ticks lived

      • hasAccessRights

        public final boolean hasAccessRights(Player player)
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the given player. If the player has the permission node "stb.access.any" then this method will always return true.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • hasAccessRights

        public final boolean hasAccessRights(UUID uuid)
        Check if this block may be interacted with by the player of the given UUID, based on its current security settings. Note that no player permission check is done here; see BaseSTBItem.checkPlayerPermission(org.bukkit.entity.Player, me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.items.BaseSTBItem.ItemAction).
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID to check
        Returns:
        true if the block may be accessed

      • isRedstoneActive

        public final boolean isRedstoneActive()
        Check if this block is active based on its redstone behaviour settings and the presence or absence of a redstone signal.
        Returns:
        true if the block is active, false otherwise

      • onBlockDamage

        public void onBlockDamage(BlockDamageEvent event)
        Called when an STB block receives a damage event. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the block damage event

      • onBlockPhysics

        public void onBlockPhysics(BlockPhysicsEvent event)
        Called when an STB block receives a physics event, i.e. a neighbouring block has changed state in some way. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the block physics event

      • onRedstonePowerChanged

        public void onRedstonePowerChanged(int oldPower,
                          int newPower)
        Called when the redstone power being supplied to an STB block changes.
        Parameters:
        oldPower - the block's current power level
        newPower - the block's new power level

      • handlePhysicsEvent

        public final void handlePhysicsEvent(BlockPhysicsEvent event)
        Don't call this method directly; override onBlockPhysics(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPhysicsEvent) instead.
        Parameters:
        event - the the block physics event

      • onInteractBlock

        public void onInteractBlock(PlayerInteractEvent event)
        Called when an STB block is interacted with by a player. The default behaviour allows for the block to be labelled by left-clicking it with a sign in hand. If you override this method and want to keep this behaviour, be sure to call super.onInteractBlock().
        Parameters:
        event - the interaction event

      • onSignChange

        public boolean onSignChange(SignChangeEvent event)
        Called when a sign attached to an STB block is updated. The default behaviour is to ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the sign change event
        Returns:
        true if the sign should be popped off the block

      • onEntityExplode

        public boolean onEntityExplode(EntityExplodeEvent event)
        Called when this STB block has been hit by an explosion. The default behaviour is to return true; STB blocks will break and drop their item form if hit by an explosion.
        Parameters:
        event - the explosion event
        Returns:
        true if the explosion should cause the block to break, false otherwise

      • getBlockStructure

        public BaseSTBBlock.RelativePosition[] getBlockStructure()
        Get a list of extra blocks this STB block has. By default this returns an empty list, but multi-block structures should override this. Each element of the list is a vector containing a relative offset from the item's base location.
        Returns:
        an array of relative offsets for extra blocks in the item

      • tick

        public final void tick()
        This method should not be called directly. It is automatically called every tick for every block placed in the world for which getTickRate() returns a non-zero value.

      • onServerTick

        public void onServerTick()
        Called every tick for each STB block that is placed in the world, for any STB block where getTickRate() returns a non-zero value. Override this method to define any periodic behaviour of the block.

      • getTickRate

        public int getTickRate()
        Defines the rate at which the block ticks. onServerTick() will be called this frequently. Override this method to have the block tick at the desired frequency. The default rate of 0 means that the block will not tick at all.

      • onBlockBurnt

        public void onBlockBurnt(BlockBurnEvent event)
        Called when an STB block has completely burned away. This is called with EventPriority.MONITOR; do not attempt to cancel this event.
        Parameters:
        event - the block burn event

      • getLocation

        public final Location getLocation()
        Get the location of the base block of this STB block. This could be null if called on an STB Block object which has not yet been placed in the world (i.e. in item form).
        Returns:
        the base block location

      • getRelativeLocation

        public final Location getRelativeLocation(BlockFace face)
        Get the location relative to this block in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        face - the direction
        Returns:
        the relative location

      • getPersistableLocation

        public final me.desht.dhutils.PersistableLocation getPersistableLocation()
        Get a persistable location for the base block of this STB block. This could be null if called on an STB Block object which has not yet been placed in the world (i.e. in item form).
        Returns:
        the base block location

      • setLocation

        public final void setLocation(me.desht.sensibletoolbox.core.storage.LocationManager.BlockAccess blockAccess,
               Location loc)
        This method should not be called directly; it is implicitly called when a block is placed, either by player or by the placeBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block, org.bukkit.entity.Player, org.bukkit.block.BlockFace) method.
        Parameters:
        loc - the base block location
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the new location is null or the block's current location is non-null

      • moveTo

        public final void moveTo(me.desht.sensibletoolbox.core.storage.LocationManager.BlockAccess blockAccess,
          Location oldLoc,
          Location newLoc)
        Don't call this method directly.
        Parameters:
        oldLoc - the block's previous location
        newLoc - the block's new location

      • preRegister

        public final void preRegister(me.desht.sensibletoolbox.core.storage.LocationManager.BlockAccess blockAccess,
               Location location,
               boolean isPlacing)
        Don't call this method directly; it is implicitly called when a block is registered with STB. Override onBlockRegistered(org.bukkit.Location, boolean) if you need to run a specific task on registration.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where the block has been registered
        isPlacing - if true, this is being called because the block is being placed by a player; if false, because the block is being restored from persisted data

      • onBlockUnregistered

        public void onBlockUnregistered(Location location)
        Called when an STB block has been broken and is being unregistered. The block's location and GUI (if any) are still valid at this point, but all physical blocks have been set to AIR. Use this method to perform any block-specific shutdown tasks, e.g. drop items from inventory.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the base (primary) block of this STB block

      • onBlockRegistered

        public void onBlockRegistered(Location location,
                     boolean isPlacing)
        Called when an STB block has been registered with the location manager after being placed. The physical block has not necessarily been drawn in the world at this point, but getLocation() will return the block's location.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where the block has been registered
        isPlacing - if true, this is being called because the block is being placed by a player; if false, because the block is being restored from persisted data

      • placeBlock

        public final void placeBlock(Block block,
              Player player,
              BlockFace facing)
        Do the basic initialisation for a newly-placed STB block. This method does not actually place the physical block in the world. This does not normally need to be called directly (STB's built-in BlockPlaceEvent handler usually deals with this), but it may be useful where a block is placed by some other means.
        Parameters:
        block - the world block where this STB block is being placed
        player - the player placing the block
        facing - the direction that the block should face

      • breakBlock

        public final void breakBlock(boolean dropItem)
        Cause this STB block to break, removing it, any auxiliary blocks and any attached label signs from the world. This is automatically called when a block is broken by a player, but can be called directly if the block should be broken by some other means.
        Parameters:
        dropItem - if true, drop the block's item form as a collectable item

      • validatePlaceable

        public final boolean validatePlaceable(Location baseLoc)
        Validate that this STB block (which may be a multi-block structure) is placeable at the given location.
        Parameters:
        baseLoc - the location of the STB block's base block
        Returns:
        true if the STB block is placeable; false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • update

        public final void update(boolean redraw)
        Mark this block as having been modified and thus in need of saving. This should be called whenever a serializable field of a block is modified to ensure that the change is saved to persistent storage.

        This method is a no-op if the block is not actually placed in the world, i.e. it's a item in an inventory

        Parameters:
        redraw - if true, also redraw the block in the world

      • repaint

        public void repaint(Block block)
        Called when a block needs to be repainted due to some state change. If you override this method (to repaint auxiliary blocks), be sure to call the superclass method.
        Parameters:
        block - the base (primary) block of this STB block

      • getPistonMoveReaction

        public PistonMoveReaction getPistonMoveReaction()
        Check if this STB block can be pushed or pulled by a piston, and if doing so would break it. The default behaviour is to allow movement; override this in subclasses to modify the behaviour.
        Returns:
        the move reaction: one of MOVE, BLOCK, or BREAK

      • supportsRedstoneBehaviour

        public boolean supportsRedstoneBehaviour(RedstoneBehaviour behaviour)
        Check if this block supports the given redstone behaviour mode.
        Parameters:
        behaviour - the mode to check
        Returns:
        true if the block supports this behaviour; false otherwise

      • isFlammable

        public boolean isFlammable()
        Check if this block is flammable. This can be used to override the flammability of blocks, i.e. to make an STB block non-flammable even if its base material is flammable.
        Returns:
        true if the block should be flammable; false otherwise

      • isPendingRemoval

        public boolean isPendingRemoval()
        Check if this block is due to be removed. This will be set to true by the breakBlock(boolean) method to indicate that the block will be removed by the end of this server tick.
        Returns:
        true if the block is due to be removed; false otherwise

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class BaseSTBItem

      • detachLabelSign

        public void detachLabelSign(BlockFace face)
        Don't call this method directly; it is automatically called when a label sign attached the block is broken.
        Parameters:
        face - the face to which the sign was attached
